definitions.text: one of a pair of planks used to make a track for rolling or sliding objects
a restraint provided when the brake linings are moved hydraulically against the brake drum to retard the wheel's rotation

examples: the car skidded in the curve on the wet road

definitions.text: apply a brake or skid to
move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
examples: the wheels skidded against the sidewalk
